public abstract class CommandExpression
extends AbstractExpression

A CommandExpression is an expression formed by a command name and arguments for the command.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

parseBoolean

protected boolean parseBoolean(Expression arg,
                               Properties options,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String key)
Parses an argument as a boolean for a specified argument name and sets an option with a specified key based on the -/+ sign at the beginning of the argument.

Parameters:
arg - an argument
options - options
name - the name of the argument to be matched
key - the key of the option to be set
Returns:
true if the specified argument (with additional -/+ sign at the beginning) matches the name to be matched
